p: When compared with the coprecipitation method, high-temperature procedures give rise to a better control of the size, size distribution, and shape of magnetic nanoparticles [ 30, 47]. As in the coprecipitation method, different additives (such as oleic acid, sucrose, poly(acrylic acid), ionic liquids, oleylamine, poly(ethylene glycol), 1-octadecene, amino acids, citric acid, etc.) have been used in order promote the stabilization of the nanoparticles and prevent particle aggregation and in some cases to promote a one-step functionalization [ 36, 39, 48, 49, 50, 51, 52].
